title: About
text:
I‚Äôm Jasmine Chu, a recent graduate from UCLA with a degree in Statistics & Data Science and minor in Film, Television, and Digital Media. My academic background allows me to approach problems from both analytical and creative perspectives, combining data science with storytelling to bring unique insights and solutions.
Currently, I am focused on applying my skills in data analysis and statistical modeling to real-world challenges. I am particularly interested in how data-driven insights can influence decision-making in the entertainment industry.
When I‚Äôm not immersed in my studies, I enjoy dancing, video editing, hiking, going to concerts, and exploring new destinations!

title: Jasmine Chu
text:
Hello! üëã I'm Jasmine, a recent graduate from UCLA with a degree in Statistics & Data Science and minor in Film, Television, and Digital Media.
  
  


Data Projects

 Analysis of Factors Influencing Bill Success in Massachusetts State-Level Legislature

Data Analyst & Researcher (Team)


March 2025

Led the network graph analysis in R on 60,000+ Massachusetts state bills, applying the Louvain algorithm and centrality metrics to uncover key legislators and collaboration patterns through co-sponsorship data
Collaborated with a team to analyze bill success factors for a client using chi-squared tests, logistic regression, and network analysis




 Caffeine and Physical Performance Study

Data Analyst & Researcher (Team)


June 2024

Conducted an experiment with 150 participants in the ‚ÄúThe Islands‚Äù program to investigate the effect of varying caffeine levels on physical performance, specifically measuring 100m sprint times outdoors
Applied statistical methods, including residual plots, blocking, and ANOVA, to analyze performance data
Delivered data-driven recommendations for optimizing physical performance strategies




 Solar Radiation Prediction Using Multiple Linear Regression

Data Analyst & Researcher (Team)


March 2024

Developed a power-transformed regression model using 32,686 HI-SEAS observations to predict solar radiation and provide climate insights for tracking patterns and impacts
Conducted data cleaning, Box-Cox transformations, and assumption testing for model accuracy




Project WE

Website:  https://projectwe.github.io/


Web Designer & Web Developer


December 2022

Constructed a data analysis on women‚Äôs education with a team of 4 using datasets and visualizations
Led the design and development process, utilizing Mobirise, HTML, and CSS
Additionally created graphs & maps on Tableau, cleaned datasets, and finalized contents on the website
